{"step_by_step_thinking": "The mother is HBsAg positive and anti-HBeAg positive. According to the documents, the risk of transmission of HBV from HBsAg carrier mothers to their infants is higher if the mother is HBeAg positive. In this case, the mother is HBeAg negative (anti-HBeAg positive), which indicates a lower risk of transmission. Therefore, the risk of transmission of Hepatitis B in the child is low.", "answer_choice": "C"}
